     Ã‚Â¦Ã‚Â¦    The final months of World War II are chronicled, including    Ã‚Â¦Ã‚Â¦
      Ã‚Â¦    the death of President Roosevelt; the discovery of Nazi       Ã‚Â¦
      Ã‚Â¦    concentration camps by U.S. and British troops; and the       Ã‚Â¦
      Ã‚Â¦    Germans&#039; surrender on May 8, 1945. In the Pacific, however,   Ã‚Â¦
      Ã‚Â¦    the war drags on, with a fierce fight for the Japanese        Ã‚Â¦
      Ã‚Â¦    island of Okinawa; and the prospect of a years-long struggle  Ã‚Â¦
      Ã‚Â¦    for Japan itself. Everything changes in August, however,      Ã‚Â¦
     _Ã‚Â¦    when the U.S. drops atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki.   Ã‚Â¦_
